intro: Brachyscome tetrapterocarpa, commonly known as the four-winged brachyscome, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has distinctive, narrow, four-winged fruits that aid in wind dispersal of its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
